DOC.brief_summary: Objective : The objective study evaluate feasibility , acceptability effectiveness 6-month nurse-led , interprofessional mental health promotion intervention aim old home care client depressive symptom use personal support service . Methods/Design : This one-group pre-test post-test study aim recruit total 250 long-stay ( > 60 day ) home care client , 70 year old , depressive symptom receive personal support service home care program Ontario , Canada . The nurse-led intervention multi-faceted 6-month program lead Registered Nurse involve regular home visit , monthly case conference , evidence-based assessment management depression use interprofessional approach . The primary outcome change severity depressive symptom baseline 6 month use Centre Epidemiological Studies Depression Scale . Secondary outcome include change prevalence depressive symptom anxiety , health-related quality life , cognitive function , rate appropriateness depression treatment baseline 12 month . Changes cost use health service assess societal perspective .
